result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald Easterling Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to 10cf923.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 3 years in custody on this case.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Ct signed order.  Restitution to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

$278 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  $250 DNA surcharge remitted.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant not to use or possess any dangerous weapon.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any victims or co-defns. No contact with any known gang members.
Completion of aggression/anger management treatment.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
